name: CreateConfluentResource
description:
Create a Confluent resource for a specified account.

Use this tool to create a Confluent resource within a specific account using its ID. It's useful for managing Confluent resources in Datadog integrations.

parameters.name: confluent_account_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Confluent account for which to create the resource.

parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.description: The type of Confluent resource to create: `kafka`, `connector`, `ksql`, or `schema_registry`.

value_schema.description: The resource type of the Resource. Can be `kafka`, `connector`, `ksql`, or `schema_registry`.

parameters.name: confluent_resource_id
parameters.description: The unique ID for the Confluent resource to be created or managed.

value_schema.description: The ID associated with a Confluent resource.

parameters.name: json_api_request_type
parameters.description: The JSON:API type for this request. Must be 'confluent-cloud-resources'.

value_schema.description: The JSON:API type for this request.

parameters.name: resource_tags
parameters.description: A list of tag strings for the Confluent resource. Use key-value pairs separated by colons or single keys.

value_schema.description: A list of strings representing tags. Can be a single key, or key-value pairs separated by a colon.

parameters.name: enable_custom_metrics
parameters.description: Set to true to enable the `custom.consumer_lag_offset` metric with extra tags, false to disable.

value_schema.description: Enable the `custom.consumer_lag_offset` metric, which contains extra metric tags.
